intro: Wulfenia reniformis, commonly known as the kidneyleaf wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive kidney-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of blue or purple. Wulfenia reniformis is an important species in ecological studies due to its role in supporting local insect populations.
